title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
before this is fully working board with keyboard issue only, 
i just accidentally removed th cd3215 chip by mistake. but when i 
put back the cd3215 chip got this 5.19V 1.42amp even i changed new cd3215. 

PPBUS_G3H 0v 0.427  (diode to ground)
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR|PPDCIN_G3H 5.2V

PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC 0V 0.518  (diode to ground)
PP1V8D_UPC_XA_LDO 1.8V
PP1V8A_UPC_XA_LDO 1.77V
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO 3.27V

what to do next???

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
1.4A is very high current for 5V on USB port and no PPBUS_G3H.
I suppose overcurrent on 3V3_G3H, or 3V0_AON power rail; check exact voltage and diode mode to ground there.

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
Something should heat on the board.
An IR thermal cam helps to find it; possibly U7000.

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
u7000 was replaced
theres no heat on the board
using ir camera theres no heat greater than 26 degree celcius

what can be posibly damage after removing u3100

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message: What is the actual current consumption on USB-C port?

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
Is that without battery?

Test the board w/o battery connected.
Cannot have such big consumption in off state.

title: 820-00244 a1534 stuck at 5.19V 1.42amp
message:
Nothing will overheat, but your board takes around 7W in off state.
That's the reason I said to use IR cam; cannot detect small heat other way.

Which component appears with 26 degrees?
Being the "hotest" one in this case...
